Dear Ms. Cheatham:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
9/10/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or
parents and the foster parents in the development
of service plans to enable the parent or parents
and foster parents to understand the plan for the
child and the parents' and the foster parent's role
in assisting the agency in carrying out the plan. An
agency shall give a copy to and review the parent-
agency treatment plan with the parent or parents
and foster parents. The agency must inform the
parent or parents and foster parent that the
information in the parent-agency treatment plan
and any other information about the child and the
child's family is confidential.
Four of six foster care case records and one independent living case file reviewed
did not indicate that the plan was developed with the parent/parents or foster
parents to enable the parent/parents/foster parents to understand the plan.
CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
• (1) An agency social service worker shall
complete a written adoptive evaluation within 90
days of the family signing an adoption application
and prior to approving a family for adoption.
2

Three of three adoptive family records reviewed did not complete the family
evaluation within the 90 days of the signed application.

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
Special investigation # 2024SIC0001602 was initiated 7/18/2024, and the CAP
was approved on 11/27/24. The agency was found in noncompliance with
licensing rule 400.12206 (2), and 400.12207 (3). There were no repeat violations.
The agency submitted a CAP in response to the 2024 renewal inspection. The
report was completed 7/12/2024 and the CAP was approved on 8/20/2024. The
CAP addressed 3 violations. There was improvement with all of the violations that
were cited in the 2024 renewal inspection as there were no repeat violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator assessment was provided and reviewed. The chief
administrator indicated the areas that required improvement are parent-child visits,
parent-worker visits, medicals and dentals. She reported the agency implemented
additional support for parents to see their children and yet they remain
inconsistent but it’s getting better. She said the agency has struggled with
3

medicals and dentals but now have implemented a support person who follows up
on medicals/dentals with the medical providers on a monthly basis. CA stated they
have implemented the use of calendar reminders, email reminders, monthly CAP
review meetings, quarterly quality review meetings, and use of BOB & KPI data.
Financial Overview:
The agency annual audit by an independent certified public accountant dated
September 30, 2024, and 2023, and their annual budget were reviewed. No
concerns were noted.
Staff Interviews:
Three staff were interviewed onsite 8/6/2025. Staff interviewed reported no
concerns. All staff reported receiving support from their immediate supervisors
and coworkers and the chief administrator. Staff feel they are well informed of rule
and policy updates timely. Staff reported they love working for the agency and
could not think of anything they would change involving the agency.
Description of Agency Walk Through:
The building has adequate space to provide the required services for families and
their children. The office has secure storage for confidential information. There is
adequate space for staff and clients to conduct business and hold visits.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There was one identified safety concern.
Safety Alert:There was not an operable smoke detector on each level of occupancy.
Resolution: Foster Care Worker contacted the caregiver on 6/9/2025. A smoke
alarm was missing from the basement level. The caregiver reported the smoke
detector was found in a box and was installed. Photo was attached to the safety
alert.
4

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
